full_summary:
### Tender Notice O'Connor Lake Mine Remediation Work

**Title**

Projet d’assainissement de la mine O’Connor Lake / O’Connor Lake Mine Remediation Work

**Reference Number**

PW-NCS-118-12337

**Solicitation Number**

EW699-230990/B

**Publication Date**

October 31, 2022

**Tender Closing Date**

November 15, 2022, 3:00 PM (EST)

### Project Description

This tender notice is for the remediation work of O'Connor Lake Mine, a contaminated site located in the Northwest Territories. The project involves the remediation of approximately 10 hectares of land, containing 11 structures, a headframe, and various areas of scattered debris.

### Background

The O'Connor Lake Mine operated between 1949 and 1952, producing 4,300 tonnes of rock and 900 tonnes of ore. The site is currently managed by Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Canada (CIRNAC).

### Project Scope

The scope of the project includes the removal of asbestos, demolition of structures, sorting of debris, containerizing and disposing of non-hazardous and hazardous debris, and restoring the site to a natural state.

### Selection Criteria

The selection of the successful bidder will be based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

### Trade Agreements

This project is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

### Regions of Opportunity

The project is located in the Northwest Territories.

### Regions of Delivery

The project will be delivered in the Northwest Territories.

### Tendering Information

All interested suppliers may submit a bid. The tendering process will be conducted in accordance with the CFTA. The Government of Canada is transitioning to electronic procurement, and suppliers are encouraged to register for a free account in SAP Ariba.

### Contact Information

Keenan, Matthew

Email: [matthew.keenan@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca](mailto:matthew.keenan@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca)

Phone: (431) 278-4884

Fax: (418) 566-6167

Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5







### Additional Information

Suppliers are encouraged to review the project requirements and submit their bids electronically through the Government of Canada's electronic procurement system. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers
